conversation.message:
Hi Student_E—thanks for reaching out, and we’re glad to hear School_C is your first choice.

In our review, we prioritize (1) strong and consistent academic preparation, (2) evidence of intellectual curiosity and initiative (projects, competitions, independent learning), (3) positive community impact (leadership, teamwork, service), and (4) character and fit—how you contribute to a respectful, collaborative school culture.

Programs and opportunities we’re especially proud of include advanced coursework options, student-led clubs and leadership pathways, and structured academic support/mentoring so students can stretch while staying well-supported.

If you’re comfortable sharing: what academic area excites you most right now, and what’s one activity or project you’ve pursued outside of class that you’re proud of? That’ll help us point you to the best opportunities at School_C.

Outside of class, I’m proud of a self-directed project where I taught myself Python basics and built a simple study/quiz tool for classmates, iterating based on their feedback. I also try to contribute positively in group settings by organizing tasks and making sure everyone’s voice is heard.

School_C is my first choice because I’m looking for a collaborative, high-expectations environment with strong support and room to explore advanced coursework and clubs.

Thank you for your consideration.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Team,

Thank you for keeping the door open to potential reconsideration if your seat remains unfilled. As you suggested, I’m sending (1) a brief 1-page overview of my quiz tool and (2) my most recent term grades.

(1) Quiz Tool – 1-page overview (summary)
• Purpose: help classmates practice efficiently for tests using short, targeted quizzes.
• Key features I built: 
  – Question sets by topic + quick quiz mode
  – Spaced-repetition scheduling (questions reappear based on past performance)
  – Progress dashboard (accuracy by topic + streaks)
• Use/testing: 5 classmates tried it over two weeks; I collected feedback via a short form and made changes (simplified navigation, clearer topic labels, added “review missed questions”).
• What I learned: translating user feedback into specific improvements, debugging edge cases in scheduling, and balancing features with usability.
If you’d like, I can share a link/demo or screenshots in whatever format you prefer.

(2) Most recent term grades
• Math: A
• Science: A
• English: A-
• Social Studies: A
(And I’m happy to provide an official transcript/report if needed.)

School_C remains my first choice because of your rigorous academics and strong student-led culture, and I would enroll if offered a seat.

Thank you again for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E

If School_C is still your first choice and you would enroll immediately if offered, the next step is for you to submit an [APPLY] message to us (a brief confirmation is fine). You do not need to send additional materials right now; if an updated *official* term report becomes available later, you may forward it, but it is not required to proceed.

Once we receive your [APPLY], we will be able to give you a definitive decision.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[TALK]
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list is B > A > D > E > C. Student_E is 4th on my list and has already been rejected earlier; however, my seat is still unfilled in Round 10. No higher-priority students (B/A/D) are currently in my inbox, and Student_E continues to show strong interest and would enroll immediately, reducing the risk of remaining unmatched. Since Student_E sent [TALK] (not [APPLY]), I should not accept yet; I should prompt an [APPLY] now that we are reassessing, while keeping flexibility in case a higher-priority student approaches in the next round. Best move: invite Student_E to submit an application this round/next, clarify that we are reopening consideration and can make a final decision upon receipt.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Team,

Thank you for reopening consideration. As you noted, I’m submitting my formal application/confirmation.

[APPLY] School_C remains my first choice, and if offered the seat I will accept immediately and enroll.

Thank you again for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. School_C has reopened consideration and explicitly requested an [APPLY] to render a definitive decision. I should apply immediately, clearly confirm School_C is my first choice and that I will enroll upon acceptance, and keep the message brief as they said confirmation is sufficient.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your confirmation and for your continued patience throughout the process.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We appreciate your clear commitment that School_C is your first choice and that you will enroll if offered.

Welcome to School_C—we look forward to having you join our community.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and only Student_E in the inbox this round with an [APPLY]. On our true priority list, Student_E is ranked 4th (after B, A, D). However, none of those higher-priority students are currently applying to us, and holding the seat longer risks ending unmatched, while Student_E has repeatedly confirmed School_C as first choice and immediate enrollment. Given we reopened consideration specifically due to an unfilled seat, accepting Student_E now secures a match and avoids leaving the seat empty.
